text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Public prosecutors will only support successor to state prosecutor Juan Ortiz Urculo that will punish "rebel" prosecutors.
- Ruling Popular Party accuses ex-director of tax agency of pardoning debts of La Caixa.
EL MUNDO
- Creation of new tax to finance health divides government.
- Only two of seven accused in "Costa Polvoranca" crime are sentenced.
- Disciplinary action brought against Barcelona magistrate for sexually harassing civil servant.
DIARIO 16
- Public prosecutors get mad with government.
- Snow returns to Spain.
ABC
- Socialist party paid 199 million pesetas to company Prensa Sur, co-owner of Andalucia Post from 1988 to 1992.
CINCO DIAS
- Rise in price of pork threatens to close meat companies.
- Constitutional doubts over compensation for traffic accidents.
EXPANSION
- Government believes inflation can fall in May to 1.5 percent.
- Competition Defence body dismantles distribution monopoly of Tabacalera.
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Electricity law liberalises tariffs for all consumers.
- Catalan president Jordi Pujol brands as serious failure lack of accord on revision of health financing system.
- Argentaria storms through 7,00 pesetas on stock market.
